title: How eXp Hub Is Structured for Collaboration and Support
excerpt: Learn how eXp Hub powers agent collaboration at eXp Realty with groups, events, messaging, and secure knowledge sharing built for a global brokerage.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Hub is eXp Realty’s proprietary internal community platform that centralizes agent communication, collaboration, events, and knowledge sharing inside a secure, verified environment. By owning its communication infrastructure, eXp reduces reliance on third-party tools while supporting global collaboration across its cloud brokerage.

TL;DR About eXp Hub at eXp Realty

  •  eXp Hub is eXp Realty’s internal community and collaboration platform
  •  It replaces third-party tools previously used for internal communication
  • Access is limited to verified eXp agents, brokers, and staff
  • Features include groups, events, messaging, and shared knowledge resources
  • It functions as part of eXp Realty’s broader technology ecosystem

At eXp Realty, technology is not a collection of disconnected tools. It is an integrated ecosystem designed to replace physical offices, reduce friction, and help agents collaborate at scale. eXp Hub plays a central role in that system by giving agents, brokers, and staff a secure place to communicate, share knowledge, and stay connected across markets and countries. Instead of relying on third-party platforms built for other industries, eXp built a solution around how real estate agents actually work inside a global cloud brokerage.

This article explains how eXp Hub fits into the broader eXp Realty technology ecosystem available to eXp agents.

Table of Contents

Why eXp Built eXp Hub Instead of Using Third-Party Tools
What eXp Hub Is and Who Uses It
How eXp Agents Use eXp Hub Day to Day
Groups, Events, and Knowledge Sharing
Security, Verification, and Privacy
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Hub

Is eXp Hub intended to replace physical office communication?
How does eXp Hub compare to Slack or Workplace?
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Technology

Why eXp Built eXp Hub Instead of Using Third-Party Tools

For years, eXp agents used Workplace by Facebook as their internal collaboration platform. It worked well because it felt familiar, supported open discussion, and made it easy for agents to learn from one another.

When Meta discontinued Workplace, eXp initially transitioned agents to Slack to maintain continuity. Slack is a strong tool for task-driven teams, but many agents found it fragmented for large-scale real estate collaboration. Channels became noisy. Conversations were easy to miss. Knowledge sharing felt siloed.

Rather than forcing agents to adapt to tools built for other industries, eXp made a strategic decision.

eXp built eXp Hub, a proprietary platform designed around how real estate agents actually communicate, collaborate, and grow businesses inside a global brokerage.

This move eliminated reliance on third-party platforms that can be sunset, repriced, or restructured without regard for agent experience. More importantly, it allowed eXp to design collaboration as a core system, not an add-on.

What eXp Hub Is and Who Uses It

eXp Hub is the official internal community platform for eXp Realty worldwide. Every user inside the platform is verified through eXp, creating a secure, professional environment.

The platform supports every role inside the brokerage:

Agents use eXp Hub to ask questions, share strategies, access training, find referrals, and connect with peers across markets.

Brokers use it to support agents, share compliance updates, host discussions, and communicate consistently across regions.

Staff use eXp Hub to make company announcements, organize events, moderate discussions, and provide operational support.

Because eXp Hub is owned and governed by eXp Realty, features and updates are driven by agent feedback rather than outside product roadmaps.

How eXp Agents Use eXp Hub Day to Day

At its core, eXp Hub mirrors how agents naturally collaborate, without geographic limits.

The social feed allows agents to post questions, insights, wins, and announcements. New agents learn by observing experienced agents solve real-world problems. Experienced agents stay sharp by staying connected to evolving best practices.

Direct messaging makes it easy to connect one-on-one with other agents, brokers, or staff without switching platforms or hunting through directories.

Groups and communities organize conversations by region, specialty, language, or business focus. Whether an agent works in luxury, relocation, investing, or agent attraction, there is a dedicated space to connect with others doing similar work.

Unlike email or closed chat tools, conversations inside eXp Hub remain visible, searchable, and reusable. Knowledge compounds instead of disappearing into private inboxes.

Groups, Events, and Knowledge Sharing

eXp Hub combines conversation with action.

Agents can discover events and meetups directly inside the platform, including local gatherings, training sessions, masterminds, and company-wide announcements. This eliminates scattered calendars and missed links.

The knowledge base allows agents to access shared training materials, documentation, and community-contributed resources. This dramatically shortens learning curves, especially for agents entering new markets or business models.

Because eXp Hub is global, agents are no longer limited to learning from a single office or broker. They gain access to insight from tens of thousands of professionals operating across different markets and price points.

Security, Verification, and Privacy

eXp Hub is not public-facing social media.

Access requires eXp authentication, ensuring that all users are verified agents, brokers, or staff. Role-based permissions control who can access sensitive information, while privacy settings allow conversations to live at the appropriate level.

Because eXp owns the platform, data is not monetized through advertising, and governance remains aligned with the brokerage’s long-term interests.

This level of control is rare in real estate and becomes increasingly important as brokerages scale globally.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Hub

Is eXp Hub intended to replace physical office communication?

eXp Hub centralizes communication, announcements, and collaboration for agents who may not rely on a physical office. While it does not prevent agents from using other tools locally, it serves as the primary internal platform for brokerage-wide interaction, updates, and shared knowledge across markets.

How does eXp Hub compare to Slack or Workplace?

Unlike Slack, which is channel-based and task-oriented, eXp Hub is structured around verified roles, communities, and events specific to real estate workflows. It most closely mirrors Workplace but is owned and governed by eXp Realty, avoiding reliance on external platform decisions.

Who benefits most from using eXp Hub regularly?

Agents who collaborate across markets, participate in company training, follow brokerage updates, or engage in referral and specialty groups tend to benefit most. It is particularly useful for agents who value shared learning and visibility into brokerage-wide activity.

How does eXp Hub support agents working in different locations?

Because eXp Hub operates globally, agents can access groups, discussions, and events regardless of location or time zone. This allows agents to stay connected to peers, brokers, and company resources without geographic limitations or reliance on local offices.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

eXp Hub is designed to support agent communication, collaboration, and shared learning at scale, but it does not operate in isolation or replace the broader brokerage experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

Agents who join eXp Realty and name a Smart Agent Alliance (SAA) aligned agent as sponsor gain access to organized sponsor infrastructure designed to preserve long-term optionality. This access includes done-for-you systems made available without cost or obligation.

Smart Agent Alliance is directly aligned with the Wolf Pack, one of eXp Realty’s most established sponsor organizations. Through this alignment, agents gain access to Wolf Pack training resources that are otherwise available for purchase, along with participation in the Wolf Pack community, without additional fees.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do all eXp Realty agents receive access to eXp Hub?

Yes. All verified eXp Realty agents, brokers, and staff receive access to eXp Hub as part of the brokerage’s core infrastructure. Access is not dependent on production level, team affiliation, or sponsor selection, and is available globally.

Is eXp Hub designed to replace CRM or transaction software?

No. eXp Hub is focused on communication and collaboration rather than client management or transaction processing. It complements CRM systems, transaction management platforms, and marketing tools by supporting internal interaction and shared knowledge.

Is eXp Hub secure and private?

Access to eXp Hub requires eXp authentication, ensuring all users are verified members of the brokerage. Role-based permissions control visibility, and the platform is governed internally by eXp Realty rather than monetized through advertising or third-party data use.

Can agents still use Slack or other communication tools?

Yes. Agents may continue using Slack or other communication tools for team collaboration, referrals, or specialty groups. eXp Hub serves as the brokerage’s primary internal communication platform, but participation in external tools is optional and typically driven by sponsor teams, training groups, or personal workflow preferences.

Does eXp Hub operate internationally?

Yes. eXp Hub operates globally and supports agents, brokers, and staff across all countries where eXp Realty is active. Groups, discussions, events, and announcements are accessible regardless of location or time zone, allowing agents to collaborate and stay informed without geographic restrictions.

Related eXp Realty Technology

eXp Hub works alongside other core tools within eXp Realty’s technology platform. If you are exploring how communication and collaboration function inside a cloud brokerage, these related guides provide additional context:

  • eXp World – How agents use the virtual campus for live training, meetings, and broker support
  • My eXp App – Mobile access to key brokerage systems, events, and resources
  • Canva Pro – How eXp agents use Canva Pro to create marketing materials, social content, and visual assets that integrate with their broader tech stack.

title: What eXp Onboarding Exceptions Are Available for Agents
excerpt: Learn how eXp onboarding exceptions like RSPA, LOI Soft Start, and cap deferment protect agents before they join, with Smart Agent Alliance support.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp onboarding exceptions allow agents to manage sponsorship, licensing timing, and cap exposure before joining the brokerage. Tools like the RSPA, LOI Soft Start, and cap deferment formalize transition planning so agents can protect income, structure, and business continuity during a brokerage change.

TL;DR About eXp Onboarding Exceptions For Agents

  • eXp onboarding exceptions address timing, sponsorship, and cap overlap issues before an agent formally joins
  • RSPA preserves sponsor and revenue share placement before license transfer
  • LOI Soft Start allows system onboarding without active production at eXp
  • Cap deferment prevents agents from paying two brokerage caps in one year
  • All exceptions are documented, policy-driven, and reviewed through eXp corporate onboarding
  • These tools reflect eXp’s agent-centric operating model, not sponsor discretion

Most brokerages treat your move like an on/off switch. One day you are “their agent,” the next day you hand in your keys and start over somewhere else with new tech, new rules, and a nice side of chaos. Your clients do not care about that switch. Your cash flow does.

eXp Realty took the opposite approach. It looked at how agents actually live through a brokerage change, then built three onboarding exceptions around the mess: the Revenue Share Placeholder Addendum (RSPA), the LOI Soft Start, and the cap deferment exception.

These are not hallway promises. They are documented tools inside eXp’s corporate systems, designed to solve common timing and cap problems the same way every time. Used well, they let you:

  • Lock in your sponsor and revenue share spot before you can move your license.
  • Onboard into eXp systems while you still practice under your current brokerage.
  • Avoid paying two caps in the same year for the same production.

The result is simple. Before you ever join, eXp already acts like you matter.

This article explains how onboarding exceptions fit into the broader eXp Realty support ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your index:

Table of Contents

How eXp Onboarding Exceptions Help Agents Before They Join

RSPA: Hold Your Revenue Share Spot Before You Move
LOI Soft Start: Onboard Quietly While You Finish Your Current Deals
Cap Deferment: Stop Paying Two Caps For One Year Of Work
Real Agent Problems These Exceptions Actually Solve
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Onboarding Exceptions

Are eXp onboarding exceptions only for high-producing agents or team leaders?
How do eXp onboarding exceptions work in practice during a brokerage transition?
How do eXp onboarding exceptions compare to transition accommodations at other brokerages?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Support Guides

How eXp Onboarding Exceptions Help Agents Before They Join

eXp onboarding exceptions exist for one reason. Real life does not line up with clean calendar dates. Your release date, your cap cycle, your pipeline, and your recruits almost never move in the same month, let alone the same week.

Instead of forcing you to jump all at once, eXp gives you three building blocks you can stack in the order your business needs. One agent may only need the RSPA to protect sponsor placement. Another may lean on LOI Soft Start to keep deals stable. A third may add cap deferment so the money side of the move feels as logical as the structural side.

That is what makes this model feel more than fair. It is forward thinking, operationally detailed, and written into a formal exceptions system instead of left to back-channel negotiations or one off promises.

Now let’s break down each exception and the specific problem it solves.

RSPA: Hold Your Revenue Share Spot Before You Move

The Revenue Share Placeholder Addendum, or RSPA, is the answer to one very expensive problem. You know you are coming to eXp. You have already chosen your sponsor. You are even talking to agents who want to follow you. The only catch is timing. Your broker will not release you yet and you still have deals in escrow.

The RSPA lets you formally commit to eXp and lock in your sponsor and revenue share placement before your license transfers. Agents you attract during that window can be reserved under you, so your future tree does not get scrambled just because your release date moved. 

For team leaders and brokers, it turns a messy “everyone rush the door at once” transition into a staged plan. Early adopters sign RSPAs first, structure and depth stay intact, and agents who come later still land where you designed them to land. That is not just fair. It is how grown-up businesses scale.

Smart Agent Alliance uses the RSPA as the starting canvas when planning complex moves, especially for leaders who care about revenue share and long-term wealth, not just this quarter’s closings.

LOI Soft Start: Onboard Quietly While You Finish Your Current Deals

The LOI Soft Start is your “join before you join” pathway. You submit a Letter of Intent during the eXp application process and tell the company you need a delayed start. eXp then gives you access to core systems, training, and onboarding steps while your license stays parked with your current brokerage. 

In that pre-active phase you can:

  • Build your marketing, listing presentation, and database imports around eXp tools.
  • Log into eXp Enterprise and the cloud campus.
  • Meet your state broker team and understand local compliance expectations.

You cannot yet practice real estate under eXp or present yourself as an eXp agent. You keep servicing clients at your current brokerage until your license officially transfers through your state commission. That split identity is exactly the point. You protect today’s business while preparing tomorrow’s systems.

Agents who use LOI Soft Start describe their actual activation day at eXp as “boring in the best way.” Everything is set up. Their first eXp deal feels like transaction number fifty, not number one. 

Cap Deferment: Stop Paying Two Caps For One Year Of Work

Cap deferment at eXp Realty is designed for agents who have already capped at their current brokerage and want to avoid “capping twice” in the same year. It lets you join eXp now, without immediately starting your eXp 80/20 split and $16,000 cap. Instead, your eXp cap year begins later on a “cap reset date” that lines up with your prior brokerage’s cap anniversary, so your financial year stays in rhythm.

During the deferment period, you are not paying toward the $16,000 eXp company dollar yet. You are paying the $250 capped-status transaction fee per closing, along with the standard fees in your ICA. Those fees during deferment do not count toward the $5,000 in transaction fees required for ICON eligibility. In short, you can move your license to eXp, keep closing business, and avoid feeling like you just paid to cap twice in a single cycle.

To qualify, you must already be capped at your current brokerage and be able to prove it with documentation, including your cap anniversary date and roughly the last 12 months of production (broker reports, screenshots, and similar). You have to request cap deferment during onboarding, submit the online application, and if approved, sign a Cap Deferment Addendum to activate it. During the deferment window, your sponsor and upline do not receive revenue share from your production, because you have not started contributing company dollar toward your eXp cap yet.

eXp likes to describe itself as “the most agent centric brokerage on the planet,” and the financials back up why it can behave that way. eXp is the only public brokerage with multiple years of cumulative profitability, which gives it room to design models that send hundreds of millions back to agents through revenue share and equity. 

Real Agent Problems These Exceptions Actually Solve

eXp onboarding exceptions are not theoretical. They solve concrete problems: agents afraid of losing their sponsor structure, leaders who cannot move teams on one date, solo producers who just paid a big cap elsewhere, and attractors whose recruits are ready faster than their broker release. This section walks through those scenarios so you can see where you fit.

Start with the solo producer who just capped at a franchise. She loves the eXp model, but she is staring at a fresh $16,000 cap if she moves now. Cap deferment lets her join, quietly onboard with LOI Soft Start, and delay her eXp cap start until her last big check at the old brokerage clears. Instead of paying double, she pays once, just with better timing.

Now picture the team leader whose group is spread across three offices. Some agents are ready to jump, some have heavy listing pipelines, and one is in the middle of a personal move. RSPAs let the leader and early adopters lock in sponsorship and structure. LOI Soft Start gives everyone system access without forcing a same-day license transfer. Cap deferment then lines up caps with each person’s cap anniversary inside eXp.

Then there is the quiet attractor. She has talked to several agents about eXp, and they are ready to name her as sponsor, but her broker will not release her until year-end. The RSPA keeps those relationships tied to her, even if those agents apply before she is active. When her license finally moves, her revenue share tree shows the structure she actually built, not whoever’s name happened to be on the application that day. 

Under all of this is a bigger truth. eXp can afford to be this agent centric because their model works while many competitors cut services or raised fees. That combination makes these exceptions feel more than fair. They are not handouts. They are proof that the business model was built around agents from the start.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Onboarding Exceptions

Are eXp onboarding exceptions only for high-producing agents or team leaders?

No. eXp onboarding exceptions are used by solo agents, experienced producers, and team leaders alike. These tools are designed to address timing, sponsorship placement, and cap alignment issues that arise regardless of production volume, especially during broker transitions with active deals or planned recruitments.

How do eXp onboarding exceptions work in practice during a brokerage transition?

They operate as formal, documented requests reviewed through eXp’s onboarding and compliance systems. Agents submit the appropriate exception during application or onboarding, provide supporting documentation, and receive written approval before the exception takes effect, ensuring consistent treatment and clear expectations.

How do eXp onboarding exceptions compare to transition accommodations at other brokerages?

Many brokerages handle transitions informally or case by case. eXp differs by offering standardized, published exception tools that address sponsorship timing, onboarding access, and cap alignment, reducing uncertainty and eliminating reliance on discretionary or undocumented arrangements.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Support like eXp onboarding exceptions is designed to address special entry scenarios before an agent formally joins, but it does not operate independently or replace the broader eXp Realty platform.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Can I join eXp Realty without using any onboarding exceptions at all?

Yes. Many agents simply apply, complete standard onboarding, and move their license in one clean step. eXp onboarding exceptions exist for situations where timing, cap overlap, sponsor structure, or team staging would otherwise create financial or operational pain during the move.

Who actually approves RSPA, LOI Soft Start, and cap deferment at eXp?

These tools run through eXp’s corporate onboarding and exceptions systems. Compliance and attraction integrity teams review RSPAs, LOI Soft Starts, and cap deferment requests to make sure they fit current policy before issuing any formal approval.

Are eXp onboarding exceptions guaranteed if I ask for them?

No. Each exception is discretionary and documentation driven. You should assume the standard model applies unless you have a written approval in hand. Strong sponsors help you present a clear case with real timing, transaction, and cap details instead of vague requests.

Do these exceptions change my eXp commission split or company dollar cap?

RSPA and LOI Soft Start do not change your split or your company dollar cap. Cap deferment does not reduce the cap either; it only shifts when your eXp cap period begins. Your financial structure still follows the published 80/20 split with a fixed company dollar cap in your market.

When should I start talking to a sponsor team about using these tools?

You should start the conversation as soon as you know eXp is likely your next brokerage and you can describe your timeline, current caps, and active pipeline. Early planning gives you more options. Waiting until your notice date often means leaving money, relationships, or structure on the table.

Related eXp Realty Support Guides

  • How eXp Realty Agent Exceptions Help After Agents Join
  • How eXp Onboarding Works in 6 Steps – And How Not to Blow It
  • How eXp Realty’s Agent Resources Leave Other Brokerages Behind

title: Understanding eXp Realty Agent Help and Support
excerpt: See how eXp Realty support actually works, from Expert Care to Mira AI, with Smart Agent Alliance helping you navigate it all. Book a call.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Realty agent help operates through a centralized, multi-layer support structure that replaces single-broker bottlenecks with routed, near-real-time support. Agents get efficient support with 24/7 Expert Care, Mira AI, and more than 2,000 staff behind the scenes.

TL;DR About eXp Realty Support

  • eXp Expert Care is a 24/7 first stop for any support issue.
  • Mira AI gives instant answers about caps, payouts, and production.
  • Agent Success and No Busters step in when stakes or emotions are high.
  • Sponsor and co-sponsor teams add local, strategic, real world help.
  • Smart Agent Alliance shows you how to navigate the whole value stack.

At most brokerages, “support” means waiting days for a broker to call back, chasing an office manager, or refreshing a shared inbox. eXp Realty agent help was built to do the opposite. With more than 2,000 staff, a cloud platform, and a very public “agent success obsessed” mantra, the goal is simple: keep agents moving, not waiting. 

The challenge is not whether help exists. It is knowing where to go first, when to escalate, and how your sponsor and co-sponsor team fits into the picture. In this guide, we map the paths you can actually use what you are already paying for.

This article explains how eXp Realty agent help fits into the broader eXp Realty support ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

Support In Minutes, Not Days
Expert Care: Human eXp Realty Agent Help, 24/7
Mira AI: Smart eXp Realty Agent Help In Your Pocket
Agent Success: Leadership That Backs You Up
No Busters: Second Opinions When “No” Should Not Be Final
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Support

Is eXp support really available 24/7?
How does eXp tech support work for agents in different countries?
Related eXp Realty Support Guides

Support In Minutes, Not Days

eXp Realty agent help is built around speed, scale, and routing instead of one overworked broker. A cloud-based support system, more than 2,000 staff, and a culture of being “agent success obsessed” turn routine problems into quick tickets instead of long dramas. The point is to keep production moving, not stall it.

Instead of relying on a single person in a single building, eXp uses centralized teams for onboarding, transactions, accounting, tech, and compliance. Those teams live inside the same platform agents use, so questions move between departments without you trying to decode who owns what. You submit one request, not five.

You also get searchable knowledge bases, live humans inside eXp World, and a mix of phone, text, chat, and email options, depending on the issue. That flexibility matters the first time a deadline is looming and you are nowhere near your “home” market. eXp’s model of being “agent success obsessed” is not just a slogan, it is how the support structure is built and funded. 

If you want a bigger-picture breakdown of how the whole system is organized, our eXp Realty support overview maps the main departments. This article focuses on how to use that support when you are actually stuck in a transaction or tech mess.

Bottom line, having a full agent help org beats hoping your broker checks voicemail before inspection day.

Expert Care: Human eXp Realty Agent Help, 24/7

Expert Care is the human front line of eXp Realty agent help and your one stop shop. It’s a available 24/7 help desk that gives fast answers, triages problems, and, if necessary, routes you to the right internal team. If you are ever unsure where to start, Expert Care is the “press this first” button. 

You can reach Expert Care by calling 833-303-0610, emailing expertcare@exprealty.net, using live chat in the My eXp app, or walking into the Expert Care Desk in eXp World. Behind that one label are subject-matter experts for onboarding, agent services, transactions, and more, so you are not stuck figuring out which department owns your problem. 

The team’s job is fast triage. They answer what they can on the spot, then route anything specialized to the right group with the relevant details included. That means you are not retelling the same story, just to be told you emailed the wrong address. When you think “I need eXp support,” Expert Care is usually the correct first move.

At Smart Agent Alliance, we show agents how to use Expert Care for the heavy lifting, then step in for strategy, scripting, or conversation prep so you know exactly what to ask and what outcome you want before you open a ticket.

Mira AI: Smart eXp Realty Agent Help In Your Pocket

Mira is eXp’s AI business assistant, built specifically for agents. It answers real estate questions, pulls your live production stats, and deep-links into the right tools so you do not have to dig through dashboards. eXp Realty agent help finally fits in your pocket instead of on a complicated spreadsheet. 

Mira launched in 2025 as an exclusive AI assistant for eXp agents, designed to streamline how you access information about your own business. You can check your cap status, FLQA count, revenue share progress, upcoming payouts, and downline details, then jump directly into the relevant app from one chat thread. 

On top of that, Mira answers practical real estate questions and policy clarifications using current company data, not guesswork. That combination of AI plus live brokerage systems is exactly what eXp describes in its official Mira launch announcement, and early coverage highlights how it reduces the time agents spend hunting for answers. 

Realistically, this is the tool that saves you from clicking through twelve dashboards to figure out, “Can I afford to take this listing at this commission rate and still cap this year?” 

Agent Success: Leadership That Backs You Up

Agent Success is one of eXp Realty’s most powerful but least talked about resources. You reach it through Expert Care by requesting an escalation to the Agent Success team, and on the other side of that request is a small group of experienced, compassionate staff whose job is to keep your business moving forward. 

This is not a basic help desk that shows you where to click. It is where you go when the question is no longer “how do I log in,” but “how do I do more deals,” “how do I protect this client relationship,” or “how do I work through a problem big enough to stall my pipeline.” The Agent Success team pays attention to production and retention, understands how brokerage decisions land in real businesses, and steps in when something serious is blocking your momentum.

Longtime leader Lisa P. built her career long before eXp and stayed because it was the first brokerage that actually let agents lead at every level, with systems and leadership that backed their decisions instead of boxing them in. That combination of autonomy and backup is exactly what Agent Success is meant to protect. 

For agents who want more than basic help desk answers, this is often where a strong sponsor ecosystem matters most. Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack are designed to sit alongside Agent Success, translating options into actual business moves, not just theory.

No Busters: Second Opinions When “No” Should Not Be Final

No Busters is eXp Realty’s second-opinion Hotline and inbox. If you believe a decision was unfair, incomplete, or flat-out wrong, this team exists so “no” is not automatically the end of the story. They gather the right experts, review the situation, and look for better solutions. 

You reach No Busters by calling 833-341-14NO or emailing NoBusters@exprealty.net during weekday hours. The team is built for escalations, not routine questions. Think commission disputes, compliance decisions that do not quite fit the facts, or account issues that are stopping a closing or payout. 

No Busters does not promise that every “no” becomes a “yes.” What it does promise is that a specialized group will gather the right internal stakeholders, take a fresh look, and give you a clear answer. In a business where one bad ruling can erase months of work, having a structured second-opinion department beats yelling into the group chat and hoping someone with authority sees it.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Support

Is eXp support really available 24/7?

eXp Realty provides 24/7 access to Expert Care as a frontline support hub. While some specialized departments operate on extended business hours rather than overnight, Expert Care remains available at all times to answer questions, triage issues, and route requests so agents are never left without a starting point.

How does eXp tech support work for agents in different countries?

eXp Realty tech specialists support agents globally, with coverage from Sunday evening at 6pm EST to Friday evening 8pm EST, provided 24/5 support. Plus, agents have access to on-demand resources in the knowledge base. Combined with eXp World and regional staff that gives international agents a consistent way to get technical help without waiting for a local office to open. 

What training supports new eXp agents beyond basic onboarding?

New and experienced agents access live and recorded classes through eXp University, along with mentorship programs, sponsor-led trainings, and company toolkits focused on sponsorship and retention. That layered approach means eXp Realty support includes formal education plus ongoing coaching as your business grows. 

How strong is agent-to-agent support at eXp Realty?

Collaboration is one of eXp’s core values. With more than 80,000 agents across dozens of countries, the platform encourages agents to share strategies, scripts, and systems in real time. Many top producers say that peer support is as valuable as the staff itself. 

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Support like eXp agent help is designed to assist agents with day-to-day questions and operational clarity inside the brokerage, but it does not operate independently or replace the broader eXp Realty platform.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is eXp Realty agent support mandatory or optional to use?

All eXp Realty agents receive access to the full support platform, but use of any specific resource is optional. Agents decide when to contact Expert Care, use Mira AI, attend training, or request escalations based on their business needs and current situation, without penalties or usage requirements.

Do all eXp agents receive access to Expert Care and Mira AI?

Yes. Expert Care and Mira AI are included for all eXp Realty agents as part of the standard brokerage platform. Access does not depend on production level, location, tenure, or sponsor choice, and remains available throughout an agent’s time at the brokerage.

Does eXp Realty agent support replace the role of a state broker?

No. eXp Realty agent support complements, but does not replace, the role of a state broker. Expert Care and support teams handle operational and platform-related issues, while state brokers remain responsible for legal, compliance, and contract matters within their jurisdiction.

Are escalation tools like Agent Success and No Busters available to every agent?

Yes. All eXp agents can request escalation through Expert Care when issues involve compliance decisions, production blockers, or payouts. These tools follow documented processes and involve the appropriate internal stakeholders rather than informal or discretionary approvals.

Does eXp Realty charge additional fees for agent support or training?

Core agent support, including Expert Care access, standard onboarding, and eXp University training, is included in eXp Realty’s fees. Some optional coaching programs or third-party services may cost extra, but the foundational support system does not require add-on payments.

Does eXp Realty agent support function the same way in every state or country?

The support structure and entry points are consistent globally, including Expert Care and training access. However, broker teams, compliance rules, documentation, and timelines vary by state or country to align with local regulations and licensing requirements.

Related eXp Realty Support Guides

eWhy eXp Employees Make This the Best Brokerage for Agent Support

Real Estate Agent Training at eXp Realty, Explained

How eXp Onboarding Works in 6 Steps – And How Not to Blow It

title: How the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division Works
excerpt: Learn how the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division helps agents serve celebrity and pro athlete clients with Smart Agent Alliance support. See if it fits you.
content:
Key Takeaway: The eXp Sports and Entertainment Division is a specialized program within eXp Realty that provides qualified luxury agents with structured training, a visible certification, and access to a vetted professional network focused on serving athletes, entertainers, and other high-profile clients with heightened privacy, coordination, and timing requirements.

TL;DR About eXp Sports and Entertainment

  • Operates inside the eXp Luxury division
  • Requires Luxury eligibility plus Sports and Entertainment certification
  • Focuses on athletes, entertainers, and high-profile clients
  • Provides training on confidentiality, advisory coordination, and fast timelines
  • Includes official branding, directory listing, and masterminds
  • Functions as a niche lane within the broader eXp Realty divisions ecosystem

Serving athletes and entertainers is not a scaled-up version of luxury real estate. These clients operate under compressed timelines, heightened privacy concerns, and advisory teams that expect precision. eXp Realty created the Sports and Entertainment Division to formalize this niche rather than leaving agents to improvise under pressure.

This article explains how the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division fits into the broader eXp Realty divisions ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

What Is the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division?
How the Division Fits Inside eXp Luxury & Costs
Training and Certification for Sports and Entertainment Agents
Branding and Marketing Tools Provided
Networking and Referrals for High Profile Clients
What Agents Ask About eXp Sports and Entertainment

What services do high end real estate agents offer for celebrity clients?
How do celebrity realtors ensure confidentiality during home sales?
Where can athletes find real estate agents who specialize in sports professionals?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Division Guides

What Is the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division?

The eXp Sports and Entertainment Division is a specialized niche program designed for agents who work with professional athletes, entertainers, media personalities, and other public-facing clients. It operates within the eXp Luxury division and builds on that foundation with targeted education, branding, and network access.

Luxury real estate already demands elevated presentation and service. Sports and Entertainment clients add another layer, confidentiality, speed, and coordination with agents, managers, attorneys, and publicists. This division provides a structured framework so agents are not inventing processes in real time.

Rather than functioning as a one-off designation, the division operates as an ongoing professional lane. Members maintain certification, participate in continuing education, and remain visible in a verified directory used by advisors and internal referral partners.

How the Division Fits Inside eXp Luxury & Costs

Eligibility for the Sports and Entertainment Division begins with eXp Luxury approval. This ensures members already operate at higher price points and meet production or credential standards associated with luxury transactions.

Once inside Luxury, Sports and Entertainment adds:

  • Advanced niche training
  • A visible credential and badge
  • Directory placement
  • Mastermind access
  • Branding specific to high-profile clients

The current annual fee is $1,495, separate from Luxury membership costs. Early or founding member pricing has existed at different times, but standard pricing applies unless otherwise offered by eXp Realty.

This layered structure protects both the division’s reputation and the clients it serves by limiting participation to agents with established systems and experience.

Training and Certification for Sports and Entertainment Agents

The Sports and Entertainment certification sits at the center of the division. Agents learn how to protect confidentiality, navigate NIL and endorsement issues, handle complex relocations, and manage high pressure timelines with full advisory teams at the table. The result is a credential, badge, and directory listing that signal real expertise, not just interest.

Course completion earns you a formal credential, a verified badge, and a listing in the Sports and Entertainment directory. That combination allows advisors, attorneys, and internal referral partners to verify certification status and division participation.

Education does not stop with the initial course. Members join live masterminds twice a month with top agents, athlete advisors, general managers, and entertainment insiders. Topics range from structuring deals for athletes on short contracts, to handling media exposure, to building systems that respond fast without burning you out. Sessions are recorded and added into the eXp Luxury Academy so you can study on demand.

This format matters if you are trying to break into, or grow inside, a niche where the rules change often. Instead of guessing what a team’s travel schedule looks like or how NIL deals affect a college athlete’s purchase, you hear directly from people living in that world. 

If you have ever tried to wing it with a VIP client, you know that formal training is cheaper than learning on the fly while someone’s agent glares at you across the table and silently questions your life choices.

Branding and Marketing Tools Provided

Sports and Entertainment members get a dedicated brand kit, official S&E logo, and a full suite of Canva templates for listing decks, buyer presentations, and social media. These tools help you show up like the real estate agent for celebrities and athletes that high profile clients expect to see, not like a generic luxury generalist.

The Sports and Entertainment branding matters more than most agents realize. A pro athlete or entertainer is judging you on more than comps. They want to know whether your materials feel like the rest of their world, or like something thrown together at the copy shop. Clean, consistent visuals signal that you understand their expectations and can match the level of their other advisors.

Because the templates live in Canva, you can plug in your own photos, colors, and local stats without hiring a designer for every update.  Good branding will not sell a house on its own, but bad branding can quietly talk a celebrity client out of calling you back while you wonder why they ghosted you.

Networking and Referrals for High Profile Clients

The Sports and Entertainment Division gives you more than a logo and a list. It connects you to a verified circle of advisors, attorneys, wealth professionals, and concierge partners, then lists you in a directory that makes you easy to find and easy to trust. Instead of begging for last minute favors, you walk into every conversation knowing you have a real bench behind you.

Behind that directory is a practical support system. Athletes and entertainers rarely need “just a house.” They need short term housing during a season, privacy focused vendors, secure transportation, and smooth moves between cities on tight timelines. The division’s vetted partner roster lets you assemble that support quickly, without guessing at vendors forty eight hours before a client arrives.

Smart Agent Alliance and the Wolf Pack layer business mechanics on top of that network. Our focus on repeatable lead generation, client experience, and scalable systems means you are not only meeting VIP clients, you are set up to serve them without chaos in your backend. Karrie Hill’s background as a lawyer and Marin County luxury agent helps keep that balance between service, compliance, and staying sane.

If your current “VIP network” is one attorney, one lender, and a cousin who once met a retired player at the gym, it is probably time for an upgrade that does not rely on luck.

What Agents Ask About eXp Sports and Entertainment

What services do high end real estate agents offer for celebrity clients?

High end real estate agents for celebrity and athlete clients do more than price and negotiate. They coordinate privacy friendly showings, work with managers and attorneys, handle complex relocations, manage media exposure, and protect public image. eXp’s Sports and Entertainment Division trains agents to deliver this level of service for clients who live in the spotlight.

How do celebrity realtors ensure confidentiality during home sales?

Celebrity realtors typically use NDAs, tightly controlled showings, vetted vendors, and need to know communication to keep a client’s details private. Inside the Sports and Entertainment certification, agents learn how to set up confidentiality procedures and work with advisors their systems match what high profile clients and their teams expect, in line with the NAR Code of Ethics.

Where can athletes find real estate agents who specialize in sports professionals?

Professional athletes usually find real estate agents through trusted advisors, team connections, and niche platforms. Within eXp’s Sports and Entertainment Division, certified agents appear in a dedicated directory and work inside a vetted network built for athletes, entertainers, and their teams.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Programs like the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division are designed to support agents working with athletes, entertainers, and high-profile clients, but they do not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is the eXp Sports and Entertainment Division mandatory for serving athletes or entertainers?

No. eXp Realty agents may represent athletes, entertainers, or other high-profile clients without joining the Sports and Entertainment Division. Membership is optional and intended for agents who want formal training, specialized branding, and access to a vetted network focused specifically on sports and entertainment clientele.

Do all eXp agents have access to Sports and Entertainment Division tools?

No. Division-specific tools, including specialized branding, certification pathways, and directory placement, are limited to agents approved and enrolled in the Sports and Entertainment Division. Agents outside the division do not receive access to these niche resources as part of the standard brokerage platform.

Does joining the Sports and Entertainment Division affect commission splits or caps?

No. Joining the Sports and Entertainment Division does not change an agent’s standard eXp Realty commission split or annual cap. Any division-related fees or requirements are separate from the brokerage compensation structure and do not affect how transactions count toward capping.

Is the Sports and Entertainment Division available internationally?

Availability is currently limited and often aligned with specific eXp Luxury or approved markets. Access depends on regulatory considerations, branding standards, and market infrastructure. Agents outside core markets should verify current availability, as international expansion may occur over time but is not universal.

Can teams join the Sports and Entertainment Division under one membership?

No. Membership in the Sports and Entertainment Division is individual. Each agent must independently qualify, complete certification, and enroll. Teams may have multiple members participate, but access to division branding, tools, and directories is tied to individual agents rather than team entities.

Related eXp Realty Division Guides

eXp Referral Division: The Best Way to Earn Without Selling Homes

What Is eXp Realty? Your Ultimate FAQ Guide for Agents

Why eXp Commercial Is Best for Commercial Real Estate Agents

title: Real Estate Agent Leads at eXp Realty Explained
excerpt: Unlock the secret to high-quality leads with eXp Realty’s Revenos program! Discover how to boost your real estate income with targeted leads.
content:
Key Takeaways: Revenos is eXp Realty’s internal referral and lead division that connects qualified buyers and sellers with trained eXp agents through structured programs. Leads are matched, not sold in bulk, and most programs operate on a pay-at-closing referral model rather than upfront ad spend.

TL;DR About Revenos Leads at eXp Realty

  • Revenos is eXp Realty’s in-house lead and referral division
  • Leads are matched to agents based on experience and certification
  • Programs focus on relocation, affinity groups, military, REO, investors, and sellers
  • Most leads are referral-based with fees paid at closing
  • All training and certifications are included for eXp agents
  • Revenos supplements, not replaces, other eXp lead systems

Real estate agent leads are one of the biggest friction points in the industry. Most agents are forced to choose between expensive paid leads or inconsistent self-generated marketing. eXp Realty takes a different approach by operating an internal division dedicated entirely to sourcing and distributing qualified opportunities to its agents.

Revenos functions as that division. It is not a single lead source, but a structured ecosystem of referral and demand-based programs designed to route real consumers to trained eXp agents.

This article explains how Revenos fits into the broader eXp Realty lead ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your index:

Table of Contents

eXp Realty’s Quality Leads
How Revenos Matches Leads to Agents?
Revenos Benefits?
How to Get Revenos Leads?
 Revenos Programs Explained

ExpressOffers
eXp Affinity
eXp Relocation
eXp Honor Military Rewards
eXp REO (Real Estate Owned)
Institutional Investment Services
eXp Bundle Select Program
Making it Rain
 Realtor Leads Pay at Closing?
What Agents Also Ask About Revenos Leads

Are Revenos leads exclusive to eXp agents?
Do agents pay upfront for Revenos leads?
How quickly do Revenos leads convert in practice?
Does Revenos replace other lead sources at eXp Realty?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Lead Guides

eXp Realty’s Quality Leads

Revenos is eXp Realty’s internal referral and lead distribution division. It operates separately from third-party portals and paid lead vendors by routing opportunities generated through corporate partnerships, relocation programs, affinity relationships, and institutional channels.

Leads distributed through Revenos are not sold in bulk. Instead, they are matched to qualified eXp agents based on program requirements, geographic coverage, and certification status. This structure is designed to route consumer demand already in motion rather than generate speculative inquiries through advertising alone.

Revenos exists to centralize brokerage-level lead sources that would otherwise be fragmented across multiple vendors or unavailable to individual agents.

Revenos offers eight distinct programs under its umbrella. Each program provides a specific type of lead, allowing agents to choose what suits them best. These programs include ExpressOffers, eXp Affinity, eXp Relocation, eXp Honor Military Rewards, eXp REO (Real Estate Owned), Institutional Investment Services, Bundle Select, and Making It Rain.

In 2024, Revenos provided thousands of top-quality real estate agent leads, generating over $2 billion in closed sales for eXp agents.

How Revenos Matches Leads to Agents

Revenos programs use predefined eligibility criteria to determine which agents may receive specific lead types. These criteria vary by program and may include licensing tenure, transaction history, certification completion, response standards, or experience with specific transaction categories.

Matching is based on operational fit rather than volume purchasing. Agents do not compete in open rotations or bidding environments. Instead, leads are routed according to program rules designed to align consumer needs with agent preparedness.

This approach allows Revenos to function as a brokerage-level routing system rather than a traditional advertising or lead resale platform.

Revenos Benefits

Revenos programs are available only to eXp Realty agents and operate as part of the brokerage’s internal lead infrastructure. Participation is optional and program access depends on meeting defined requirements.

Most Revenos programs use a referral-fee-at-closing model rather than upfront lead purchases. Referral percentages vary by program and are disclosed in advance. Some programs involve advertising or platform fees, while others do not.

Revenos is intended to supplement an agent’s broader lead strategy rather than replace organic marketing, referrals, or CRM-driven lead generation.

How to Get Revenos Leads

  • Become an eXp Agent: Join eXp Realty.
  • Get Training: Enroll in the Revenos certification training program of your choice to gain the knowledge, confidence, and expertise needed to represent clients exceptionally.  Or, better yet, enroll in all the Revenos certification training programs so you’ll be set to conquer any lead type.
  • Gain Qualifications: Gain the standards preferred by Revenos clients to increase your chances of being chosen for the real estate leads.
  • Note the Gray Area: Even if you don’t meet a client’s preferred qualifications, there are situations when you will still be the chosen agent.  So don’t delay in getting certified for maximum opportunity.

 Revenos Programs Explained

Let’s get into the various eXp referral programs and their agent qualifications. Remember, all programs are open to all eXp Agents, and all training is completely FREE. And, yes, this is on top of the arsenal of other eXp training.

ExpressOffers

ExpressOffers is a platform that aggregates multiple iBuyers (including Opendoor), ready to quickly make cash offers to sellers. eXp agents are assigned these quality leads and can earn commissions from both negotiating terms with the seller and listing the home if the iBuyer puts it back on the market.

  • Certification Format: On-Demand Course
  • Preferred Client Qualifications: ExpressOffers Certification only

eXp Affinity

eXp Affinity partners with large companies that provide various real estate-related services to their clients. Revenos forms relationships with these companies to be their source of supplying real estate agents. eXp Affinity currently includes five companies that provide these quality leads to eXp agents.

Certification Format: One Live Class offered once a month

Client Qualifications:  Agents should meet the specific qualifications of the providing company.  Currently, those preferred client qualifications start with full-time agents who have been licensed for 2 years and have done 12 transactions in the prior 12 months.

eXp Relocation

eXp Relocation works with corporations to provide services to their employees who need to transfer to a different location. eXp Relocations matches local eXp agents to these corporate transferee clients.

Certification Format: Live courses

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of one year of experience

eXp Honor Military Rewards

eXp Honor Military Rewards assists active duty, veterans, and retired service members from our US armed forces with their real estate needs.

Certification Format: Get Relocations certified in live courses

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of one year of experience

eXp REO (Real Estate Owned)

eXp agents manage and list REO properties, providing expertise in assisting financial institutions, investors, and government agencies. REO refers to any property that is taken back through either a legal foreclosure, Deed in Lieu of Foreclosure, or any other properties or notes purchased at a court foreclosure auction. REO properties may also be called Corporate Owned, Bank Owned, or Bank Repo properties.

Certification Format: Live Training

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Minimum of two years of REO experience; licensed for at least three years; experience in repair management, renovations, or property management; possesses a network of local vendors.

Institutional Investment Services

Institutional Investment Services helps some of the world’s largest landlords invest in or sell single-family rental properties by connecting them with top-performing eXp agents for expert support.

Certification Format: live training

Preferred Client Qualifications:  Experience working with investors

eXp Bundle Select Program

Bundle Select offers bundled real estate services to corporations and organizations, saving employees 20% or more on transaction fees and providing 24/7 concierge support.

Revenos provides eXp agents with customized websites and videos to educate corporations and organizations about Bundle Select’s immense value.

This is not a little deal! Currently, over 6 million employees are already on the Bundle Select Platform, including Adobe, Visa, Salesforce, Progressive, Perks at Work, and more!

Certification Format: One Live Class offered twice per month

Preferred Client Qualifications:  None, but driven by eXp agents with corporate and organization connections.

Additional Perks: eXp agents generating accounts earn a 25% referral fee from all business done through the corporations/organizations they bring into Bundle Select.

Additional Requirements: $1000 yearly subscription fee

Making it Rain

Making it Rain leverages the power of digital ads to build a client database for eXp agents that keeps on giving.  These ads are designed and placed by eXp’s expert staff, saving eXp agents time and money.

Certification Format:  On-Demand Courses with prerequisite introductory courses for each lead generation product, each taking 45 minutes to complete.

Preferred Client Qualifications:  None

Additional Requirements: eXp agents pay for these cost-effective and affordable ads (they start at just $250 per month).

 Realtor Leads Pay at Closing

With the exception of certain advertising-based programs, most Revenos opportunities operate on a referral-fee-at-closing structure. Fees typically range from 25 percent to 50 percent, depending on the program and lead source.

Referral fees apply only when a transaction successfully closes. Agents retain full ownership of future client relationships that result from completed transactions, subject to standard brokerage referral rules.

Participation in Revenos programs does not alter an agent’s commission split, cap structure, or eligibility for other eXp Realty compensation programs.s of being an agent at the most profitable brokerage out there, that’s the most agent-centric brokerage on the planet.

What Agents Also Ask About Revenos Leads

Are Revenos leads exclusive to eXp agents?

Yes. Revenos programs are available only to licensed eXp Realty agents who meet eligibility requirements and complete any required training or certification. These referral and lead programs are operated internally by eXp Realty and are not accessible to agents affiliated with other brokerages.

Do agents pay upfront for Revenos leads?

Most Revenos programs operate on a referral-fee-at-closing model rather than upfront lead purchases. Agents typically pay a percentage only when a transaction successfully closes. Making It Rain is the primary exception, as it involves paid advertising spend rather than referral fees.

How quickly do Revenos leads convert in practice?

Conversion timelines vary by program and lead type. Some Revenos leads are transaction-ready, while others involve relocation, affinity, or long-term planning scenarios that may take months to convert. Agents should expect a mix of short-term and longer-cycle opportunities.

Does Revenos replace other lead sources at eXp Realty?

No. Revenos is designed to supplement, not replace, other lead sources such as organic marketing, sphere referrals, CRM-based lead capture, and additional eXp programs like Zoocasa or BoldTrail. Agents typically layer Revenos alongside other lead channels based on capacity.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Programs like eXp Realty’s Revenos Leads are designed to provide centralized, brokerage-supported lead opportunities, but they do not operate in isolation or replace the broader eXp Realty experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is Revenos mandatory for eXp agents?

No. All Revenos programs are optional and require agents to enroll and complete any required certifications. eXp Realty agents can operate entirely without Revenos and still access the brokerage’s core platform, tools, and other lead sources. Revenos exists as an additional lead option, not a requirement.

Do all eXp agents qualify for Revenos leads?

All licensed eXp agents may apply for Revenos programs, but eligibility varies by program. Some offerings require a minimum transaction history, specific certifications, or completion of training before access is granted. These requirements exist to ensure agents are prepared to handle the lead types involved.

Are Revenos referral fees negotiable?

No. Referral fees are set by each Revenos program and are disclosed in advance of participation. Fees are standardized to maintain consistency across agents and markets. Agents agree to the referral terms as part of enrollment, and fees are applied only when a transaction successfully closes.

Can agents participate in multiple Revenos programs at the same time?

Yes. Agents may participate in more than one Revenos program concurrently, provided they meet the certification, experience, and capacity requirements for each. Agents are expected to manage response times and follow-up effectively, as stacking programs without sufficient capacity can reduce conversion success.

Does Revenos availability vary by market?

Yes. Revenos lead volume and program availability depend on geography, partner relationships, and consumer demand. Some programs are more active in certain regions than others. Availability may change over time as new partnerships are added or demand shifts within specific markets.

Related eXp Realty Lead Guides

  • Zoocasa: Hot Leads Only Available at eXp Realty
  • Lead Generation Got Smarter: Meet eXp’s “My Link My Lead” Tool
  • Should Realtors Rent Leads or Own Their Pipeline?

title: How Collaboration, Events, and Global Connection Actually Work
excerpt: Learn how eXp Realty community actually works, from daily collaboration and EXPCON events to global locations and sponsor-led connection.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Realty community is not a vibe or a slogan. It is an operating layer built into the brokerage. Agents collaborate daily across markets, attend live events that actually drive production, and plug into a global network that makes a large brokerage feel personal. Community at eXp exists at three levels: daily collaboration, live events, and local connection. Smart Agent Alliance adds an additional layer of structured community on top.

TL;DR About eXp Realty Community

  • eXp agents collaborate instead of competing because the model removes local scarcity.
  • Daily collaboration happens inside eXp World, eXp Hub, and sponsor-led masterminds.
  • Live events like EXPCON and regional rallies turn online relationships into real-world momentum.
  • Local meetups and global locations keep the cloud brokerage grounded.
  • Smart Agent Alliance adds consistent, organized collaboration inside the larger eXp ecosystem.

Most brokerages talk about culture. Few design for it.

At many traditional firms, “community” means occasional office meetings, surface-level networking, or competition disguised as camaraderie. At eXp Realty, community is built into how agents work, learn, and grow. Collaboration is not optional or accidental. It is structural.

This page is the hub for our eXp Realty Community series. Below is a big-picture map of how collaboration, events, and global connection actually function at eXp, with links to deep-dive guides for each piece so you can explore what matters most to you.

Table of Contents

How eXp Realty Community Is Structured
Daily Collaboration Inside eXp Realty

eXp World and eXp Hub
Live Events and In-Person Connection

EXPCON and Major Company Events
Regional Rallies and Market-Specific Events
Sponsor and Community Events
Local Connection Without Traditional Offices

Agent-Led Local Meetups
Global Locations and Workspace Access
Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Community
Why Realtors Need Community (and How to Find the Right One)
How Smart Agent Alliance Enhances eXp Realty Community
Smart Agent Alliance Disclosure

How eXp Realty Community Is Structured

eXp is a cloud brokerage, but that does not mean agents operate in isolation. Instead of one physical office, eXp built multiple overlapping community layers:

  • Daily collaboration through virtual platforms
  • Live events that create momentum and relationships
  • Local connection through meetups and global office access
  • Sponsor teams that make a large brokerage feel small

Each layer serves a different purpose, but together they create a working community that supports production, learning, and long-term growth.

Daily Collaboration Inside eXp Realty

The core of eXp Realty community is daily collaboration. Agents do not wait for annual conferences to connect. They collaborate every week, often every day. At a high level, eXp Realty community is built around daily collaboration. Agents do not wait for annual conferences to connect.

eXp World and eXp Hub

eXp World is the company’s virtual campus where agents attend live training, host meetings, and collaborate across markets. eXp Hub functions as the always-on communication layer, where agents share strategies, referrals, and real-time problem solving.

This combination replaces the traditional office model with something more scalable. Instead of learning only from the agents in your zip code, you learn from producers across the country and around the world.

For a full breakdown of how multi-agent collaboration works day to day, explore eXp Collaboration in our deep-dive guide.

Live Events and In-Person Connection

Online collaboration is powerful. Live events are where relationships deepen and momentum accelerates.

EXPCON and Major Company Events

EXPCON is eXp Realty’s flagship event. It brings agents together for multi-day training, strategy, leadership updates, and networking that actually leads to referrals and partnerships. This is where agents meet the people they have been collaborating with all year and turn digital relationships into real business.

Regional Rallies and Market-Specific Events

Between major conferences, eXp hosts regional rallies designed around local markets. These events focus on market-specific strategies, regional networking, and practical execution. They help bridge the gap between big-picture ideas and daily production.

Sponsor and Community Events

In addition to company-hosted events, some sponsor organizations host their own in-person gatherings. These are not required by eXp, but the best sponsor teams use them to strengthen connection, collaboration, and accountability.

To see how EXPCON, regional rallies, and sponsor-hosted events actually work, explore eXp Events in our full deep-dive guide.

Local Connection Without Traditional Offices

Even though eXp does not rely on brick-and-mortar offices, local connection still matters.

Agent-Led Local Meetups

Many eXp agents organize local meetups on their own. These range from casual coffee meetups to structured masterminds. Because the culture is collaborative rather than competitive, these gatherings tend to focus on sharing what works, not posturing.

Global Locations and Workspace Access

eXp agents also have access to physical meeting and workspace options through global office partnerships. This allows agents to meet clients, collaborate locally, or work while traveling, without being tied to a single office location.

You can explore how global access works and where agents can meet in person on the eXp Realty Locations page.

Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Community

Sponsorship at eXp exists alongside the brokerage, not above it. eXp provides the platform, systems, and global network. Sponsors determine how much additional community they create.

Many sponsors provide little or no ongoing connection. Some operate informal groups. A small number build structured communities with regular collaboration, training, and live interaction.

Smart Agent Alliance is one of those organized sponsor teams.

Why Realtors Need Community (and How to Find the Right One)

Many agents assume community will appear naturally once they join a brokerage, but most discover that proximity doesn’t equal connection. Without meaningful collaboration, even experienced agents end up solving problems in isolation, which accelerates burnout and stalls growth.

Explore why real estate community plays a critical role in retention, performance, and long-term success, and how agents can identify communities that actually support them rather than just surround them.

How Smart Agent Alliance Enhances eXp Realty Community

Smart Agent Alliance operates alongside eXp Realty’s community structure, adding an additional layer of organized collaboration.

Agents who join eXp Realty through a Smart Agent Alliance–aligned sponsor gain access to:

  • Weekly live collaboration calls with clear agendas
  • Consistent mastermind-style discussions led by active producers
  • Cross-market referral collaboration inside a smaller, trusted network
  • In-person meetups at major eXp events

This gives agents a “small room inside a big building.” You keep full access to eXp’s global community while also having a tighter group where people know your business, your goals, and your challenges.

Smart Agent Alliance Disclosure

Smart Agent Alliance operates as an organized sponsor support structure within eXp Realty. Participation is optional and occurs only when an agent independently aligns with a Smart Agent Alliance–affiliated sponsor. Agents retain full independence and control of their businesses.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions 

How does a virtual real estate community support agent collaboration at eXp Realty?

A virtual real estate community allows agents to collaborate without geographic limits. At eXp Realty, agents connect through platforms like eXp World and eXp Hub to share referrals, attend training, ask questions, and collaborate across markets in real time.

Is the eXp Realty community only online?

No. While eXp Realty operates as a cloud brokerage, agents also connect through in-person events, regional meetups, masterminds, and national conferences. The community combines virtual collaboration with real-world relationship building.

Do eXp agents actually collaborate, or is community mostly marketing?

Collaboration at eXp Realty is built into daily operations. Agents regularly exchange referrals, participate in live training, and engage in sponsor-led groups designed for practical collaboration rather than marketing alone.

Are eXp events and community activities required for agents?

No. Participation in eXp Realty community events and activities is optional. Agents choose their level of involvement based on their goals, schedule, and preferred working style.

Do all eXp Realty sponsors provide the same level of community?

No. While eXp Realty provides core community platforms, the level of additional organization, leadership, and engagement varies by sponsor. Community support depends on the sponsor an agent aligns with.

How does Smart Agent Alliance differ from the general eXp Realty community?

Smart Agent Alliance operates as a sponsor-led layer within eXp Realty, providing organized leadership access, systems, and collaboration beyond the brokerage’s baseline community for agents who choose to participate.
